meanings.definition: The act of agreeing or assenting.
meanings.sent1: Her accedences to the new rules were met with approval.
meanings.sent2: The accedences of both parties led to a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent3: The accedences to the plan made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: His accedences to her requests showed his willingness to compromise.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's accedences to the students' suggestions created a positive learning environment.

meanings.definition: The act of approaching or coming near.
meanings.sent1: The slow accedences of the car to the finish line kept the audience in suspense.
meanings.sent2: The accedences of the storm made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent3: The accedences of the dog to the cat surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The accedences of the sun to the horizon painted the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent5: The accedences of the hiker to the mountain peak filled him with a sense of accomplishment.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing or adding to.
meanings.sent1: The accedences of sugar to the recipe made it sweeter.
meanings.sent2: The gradual accedences of knowledge to his mind expanded his understanding.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected accedences of guests to the party made it livelier.
meanings.sent4: The accedences of responsibilities to his workload made him feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The continuous accedences of flowers to the garden enhanced its beauty.
